result.execSummary:
The defendant Samenthe M Lain was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Comply with any rules as set forth by the agent with regards to the custody-caretaking of the children.

timeConds.notes: 60 DAYS IN MARQUETTE COUNTY JAIL WITH HUBER. SENTENCE TO COMMENCE ON OR BEFORE 3/18/16 BY 7:00 P.M. CLEAN & SOBER.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Samenthe M Lain in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee moves to amend Ct 1 to Misd. Battery, contrary to 940.19(1).  BY THE COURT:  Court will amend as requested.  
Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Defendant to enter plea to amended Ct 1.  As part of the agreement, state will not charge cases 14-S000566 (2-22-14) and 15-S01531 (5-11-15).  State will recommend probation with argued jail time.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant enters No Contest plea to amended Ct 1.  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.
  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of amended Ct 1.
Arguments by counsel.  Defendant makes statement.
BY THE COURT:  Sentence withheld, defendant is placed on probation for a period of 12 months with the following conditions:  *Pay costs of $243.00.  *Counseling as recommended by the agent.  *Comply with any rules as set forth by the agent with regards to the custodycaretaking of the children.  *Serve 60 days in the Marquette County Jail with huber.  Sentence to commence on or before 3/18/16 by 7:00pm, clean and sober.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-21-2016 11:00 am

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz appeared by phone means for Defendant Samenthe M Lain. Prosecuting Atty Chad A. Hendee appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Samenthe M Lain in court.
Atty Gumz states that there is an agreement on the matter and and asks that this either be set for tomorrow if his client is able to or on the 20th or 21st.  Court questions the defendant.  

BY THE COURT:  Set for Plea/Sentencing.
bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 11:00 am.

bond continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 10:45 am.

bond continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Atty Hendee states that the parties are close to resolution but asks or 30 days.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Atty Gumz states that there is not resolution on the matter as of yet and would like the February trial date be left on the calendar.

BY THE COURT:  Jury Trial will be left on the calendar for February 12th.
Jury trial on February 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Samenthe M Lain in court with attorney Mark J. Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the parties have been working towards resolution.

BY THE COURT:  Set for trial.

State files Information.  Atty Gumz received the Information and waives it's reading.  Not Guilty plea entered.
BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

Defendant Samenthe M Lain in court with attorney Mark J. Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives her preliminary hearing.  Court questions Atty Gumz.  Court questions defendant on her waiver.  BY THE COURT:  Court accepts defendants waiver and find it is made freely, voluntarily and intelligently.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.  Return date scheduled for August 28, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 24, 2014 at 03:45 pm.

Defendant Samenthe M Lain in court with attorney Mark J Gumz / student intern Steve Hughes.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the detective was unavailable today and asks for a reset.  
Mr. Hughes does not object to the reset.

BY THE COURT:  Reset Prelim.
bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 24, 2014 at 03:45 pm.
STATE'S
Preliminary hearing on June 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Samenthe M Lain in court with attorney Mark J Gumz.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant's previous Attorney would not be able to represent her as now Atty Gumz has been appointed.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Gumz waives time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived; set for Prelim.
bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 19, 2014 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Samenthe M Lain in court.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant waived time limits at the last hearing and was requesting counsel.  Court questions the defendant.  Court questions to see if Atty Henney is the defendant's Attorney.  
Court confirmed that Atty Henney has a conflict so per Atty Gumz; the PD office will be reappointing an Attorney.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 02:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 21, 2014 at 02:15 pm.

with conditions:

Defendant Samenthe M Lain in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.    
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney and questions the defendant regarding the Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant asks the court to appoint an Attorney.  Defendant waives the time limits for the Prelim.  
Court states that the defendant will need to contact the PD office first before an Attorney is appointed.  

BY THE COURT:  Reset.

Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions:
*Contact with the victim will be at the supervision and discretion of the Marquette Human Services Department
*Appear for booking today  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 02:15 pm.
